module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails

-- | Details about what caused the incident to be created in Incident
--   Manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTriggerDetails</a> smart constructor.
data TriggerDetails
TriggerDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> POSIX -> TriggerDetails

-- | Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
[$sel:rawData:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the source that detected the incident.
[$sel:triggerArn:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
[$sel:source:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Text

-- | The time that the incident was detected.
[$sel:timestamp:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TriggerDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawData:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_rawData</a> -
--   Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:triggerArn:TriggerDetails'</a>,
--   <a>triggerDetails_triggerArn</a> - The ARN of the source that detected
--   the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_source</a> -
--   Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_timestamp</a>
--   - The time that the incident was detected.
newTriggerDetails :: Text -> UTCTime -> TriggerDetails

-- | Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
triggerDetails_rawData :: Lens' TriggerDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the source that detected the incident.
triggerDetails_triggerArn :: Lens' TriggerDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
triggerDetails_source :: Lens' TriggerDetails Text

-- | The time that the incident was detected.
triggerDetails_timestamp :: Lens' TriggerDetails UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.TriggerDetails.TriggerDetails


module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | Details used when updating the replication set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateReplicationSetAction</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateReplicationSetAction
UpdateReplicationSetAction' :: Maybe AddRegionAction -> Maybe DeleteRegionAction -> UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're adding to the replication set.
[$sel:addRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'] :: UpdateReplicationSetAction -> Maybe AddRegionAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
[$sel:deleteRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'] :: UpdateReplicationSetAction -> Maybe DeleteRegionAction

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateReplicationSetAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:addRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateReplicationSetAction_addRegionAction</a> - Details about the
--   Region that you're adding to the replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateReplicationSetAction_deleteRegionAction</a> - Details about
--   the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
newUpdateReplicationSetAction :: UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're adding to the replication set.
updateReplicationSetAction_addRegionAction :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSetAction (Maybe AddRegionAction)

-- | Details about the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
updateReplicationSetAction_deleteRegionAction :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSetAction (Maybe DeleteRegionAction)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types.UpdateReplicationSetAction.UpdateReplicationSetAction


module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.Types

-- | API version <tt>2018-05-10</tt> of the Amazon Systems Manager Incident
--   Manager SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS
--   service.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You don't have sufficient access to perform this action.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Updating or deleting a resource causes an inconsistent state.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied due to request throttling.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request processing has failed because of an unknown error,
--   exception or failure.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request references a resource which does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype IncidentRecordStatus
IncidentRecordStatus' :: Text -> IncidentRecordStatus
[fromIncidentRecordStatus] :: IncidentRecordStatus -> Text
pattern IncidentRecordStatus_OPEN :: IncidentRecordStatus
pattern IncidentRecordStatus_RESOLVED :: IncidentRecordStatus
newtype ItemType
ItemType' :: Text -> ItemType
[fromItemType] :: ItemType -> Text
pattern ItemType_ANALYSIS :: ItemType
pattern ItemType_ATTACHMENT :: ItemType
pattern ItemType_INCIDENT :: ItemType
pattern ItemType_METRIC :: ItemType
pattern ItemType_OTHER :: ItemType
pattern ItemType_PARENT :: ItemType
newtype RegionStatus
RegionStatus' :: Text -> RegionStatus
[fromRegionStatus] :: RegionStatus -> Text
pattern RegionStatus_ACTIVE :: RegionStatus
pattern RegionStatus_CREATING :: RegionStatus
pattern RegionStatus_DELETING :: RegionStatus
pattern RegionStatus_FAILED :: RegionStatus
newtype ReplicationSetStatus
ReplicationSetStatus' :: Text -> ReplicationSetStatus
[fromReplicationSetStatus] :: ReplicationSetStatus -> Text
pattern ReplicationSetStatus_ACTIVE :: ReplicationSetStatus
pattern ReplicationSetStatus_CREATING :: ReplicationSetStatus
pattern ReplicationSetStatus_DELETING :: ReplicationSetStatus
pattern ReplicationSetStatus_FAILED :: ReplicationSetStatus
pattern ReplicationSetStatus_UPDATING :: ReplicationSetStatus
newtype SortOrder
SortOrder' :: Text -> SortOrder
[fromSortOrder] :: SortOrder -> Text
pattern SortOrder_ASCENDING :: SortOrder
pattern SortOrder_DESCENDING :: SortOrder
newtype SsmTargetAccount
SsmTargetAccount' :: Text -> SsmTargetAccount
[fromSsmTargetAccount] :: SsmTargetAccount -> Text
pattern SsmTargetAccount_IMPACTED_ACCOUNT :: SsmTargetAccount
pattern SsmTargetAccount_RESPONSE_PLAN_OWNER_ACCOUNT :: SsmTargetAccount
newtype TimelineEventSort
TimelineEventSort' :: Text -> TimelineEventSort
[fromTimelineEventSort] :: TimelineEventSort -> Text
pattern TimelineEventSort_EVENT_TIME :: TimelineEventSort

-- | The action that starts at the beginning of an incident. The response
--   plan defines the action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAction</a> smart constructor.
data Action
Action' :: Maybe SsmAutomation -> Action

-- | The Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the
--   beginning of the incident.
[$sel:ssmAutomation:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SsmAutomation

-- | Create a value of <a>Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssmAutomation:Action'</a>, <a>action_ssmAutomation</a> - The
--   Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the
--   beginning of the incident.
newAction :: Action

-- | The Systems Manager automation document to start as the runbook at the
--   beginning of the incident.
action_ssmAutomation :: Lens' Action (Maybe SsmAutomation)

-- | Defines the Region and KMS key to add to the replication set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddRegionAction</a> smart constructor.
data AddRegionAction
AddRegionAction' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> AddRegionAction

-- | The KMS key ID to use to encrypt your replication set.
[$sel:sseKmsKeyId:AddRegionAction'] :: AddRegionAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The Region name to add to the replication set.
[$sel:regionName:AddRegionAction'] :: AddRegionAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AddRegionAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sseKmsKeyId:AddRegionAction'</a>,
--   <a>addRegionAction_sseKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key ID to use to encrypt
--   your replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionName:AddRegionAction'</a>,
--   <a>addRegionAction_regionName</a> - The Region name to add to the
--   replication set.
newAddRegionAction :: Text -> AddRegionAction

-- | The KMS key ID to use to encrypt your replication set.
addRegionAction_sseKmsKeyId :: Lens' AddRegionAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The Region name to add to the replication set.
addRegionAction_regionName :: Lens' AddRegionAction Text

-- | Use the AttributeValueList to filter by string or integer values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributeValueList</a> smart constructor.
data AttributeValueList
AttributeValueList' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Int] -> AttributeValueList

-- | The list of string values that the filter matches.
[$sel:stringValues:AttributeValueList'] :: AttributeValueList -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The list of integer values that the filter matches.
[$sel:integerValues:AttributeValueList'] :: AttributeValueList -> Maybe [Int]

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributeValueList</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValues:AttributeValueList'</a>,
--   <a>attributeValueList_stringValues</a> - The list of string values
--   that the filter matches.
--   
--   <a>$sel:integerValues:AttributeValueList'</a>,
--   <a>attributeValueList_integerValues</a> - The list of integer values
--   that the filter matches.
newAttributeValueList :: AttributeValueList

-- | The list of string values that the filter matches.
attributeValueList_stringValues :: Lens' AttributeValueList (Maybe [Text])

-- | The list of integer values that the filter matches.
attributeValueList_integerValues :: Lens' AttributeValueList (Maybe [Int])

-- | The Systems Manager automation document process to start as the
--   runbook at the beginning of the incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutomationExecution</a> smart constructor.
data AutomationExecution
AutomationExecution' :: Maybe Text -> AutomationExecution

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the automation process.
[$sel:ssmExecutionArn:AutomationExecution'] :: AutomationExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AutomationExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ssmExecutionArn:AutomationExecution'</a>,
--   <a>automationExecution_ssmExecutionArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the automation process.
newAutomationExecution :: AutomationExecution

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the automation process.
automationExecution_ssmExecutionArn :: Lens' AutomationExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an
--   incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChatChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ChatChannel
ChatChannel' :: Maybe EmptyChatChannel -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ChatChannel

-- | Used to remove the chat channel from an incident record or response
--   plan.
[$sel:empty:ChatChannel'] :: ChatChannel -> Maybe EmptyChatChannel

-- | The SNS targets that AWS Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of
--   updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident
--   through the chat channel by using the SNS topics.
[$sel:chatbotSns:ChatChannel'] :: ChatChannel -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ChatChannel</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:empty:ChatChannel'</a>, <a>chatChannel_empty</a> - Used to
--   remove the chat channel from an incident record or response plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chatbotSns:ChatChannel'</a>, <a>chatChannel_chatbotSns</a> -
--   The SNS targets that AWS Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of
--   updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident
--   through the chat channel by using the SNS topics.
newChatChannel :: ChatChannel

-- | Used to remove the chat channel from an incident record or response
--   plan.
chatChannel_empty :: Lens' ChatChannel (Maybe EmptyChatChannel)

-- | The SNS targets that AWS Chatbot uses to notify the chat channel of
--   updates to an incident. You can also make updates to the incident
--   through the chat channel by using the SNS topics.
chatChannel_chatbotSns :: Lens' ChatChannel (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A conditional statement with which to compare a value, after a
--   timestamp, before a timestamp, or equal to a string or integer. If
--   multiple conditions are specified, the conditionals become an
--   <tt>AND</tt>ed statement. If multiple values are specified for a
--   conditional, the values are <tt>OR</tt>d.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AttributeValueList -> Maybe POSIX -> Condition

-- | After the specified timestamp.
[$sel:after:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The value is equal to the provided string or integer.
[$sel:equals:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe AttributeValueList

-- | Before the specified timestamp
[$sel:before:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:after:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_after</a> - After the
--   specified timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:equals:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_equals</a> - The value is
--   equal to the provided string or integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:before:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_before</a> - Before the
--   specified timestamp
newCondition :: Condition

-- | After the specified timestamp.
condition_after :: Lens' Condition (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The value is equal to the provided string or integer.
condition_equals :: Lens' Condition (Maybe AttributeValueList)

-- | Before the specified timestamp
condition_before :: Lens' Condition (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Defines the information about the Region you're deleting from your
--   replication set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteRegionAction</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteRegionAction
DeleteRegionAction' :: Text -> DeleteRegionAction

-- | The name of the Region you're deleting from the replication set.
[$sel:regionName:DeleteRegionAction'] :: DeleteRegionAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteRegionAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionName:DeleteRegionAction'</a>,
--   <a>deleteRegionAction_regionName</a> - The name of the Region you're
--   deleting from the replication set.
newDeleteRegionAction :: Text -> DeleteRegionAction

-- | The name of the Region you're deleting from the replication set.
deleteRegionAction_regionName :: Lens' DeleteRegionAction Text

-- | Used to remove the chat channel from an incident record or response
--   plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmptyChatChannel</a> smart constructor.
data EmptyChatChannel
EmptyChatChannel' :: EmptyChatChannel

-- | Create a value of <a>EmptyChatChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newEmptyChatChannel :: EmptyChatChannel

-- | Details about a timeline event during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSummary</a> smart constructor.
data EventSummary
EventSummary' :: Text -> POSIX -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> EventSummary

-- | The timeline event ID.
[$sel:eventId:EventSummary'] :: EventSummary -> Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
[$sel:eventTime:EventSummary'] :: EventSummary -> POSIX

-- | The type of event. The timeline event must be <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
[$sel:eventType:EventSummary'] :: EventSummary -> Text

-- | The time that the timeline event was last updated.
[$sel:eventUpdatedTime:EventSummary'] :: EventSummary -> POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event happened
--   during.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:EventSummary'] :: EventSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:EventSummary'</a>, <a>eventSummary_eventId</a> - The
--   timeline event ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTime:EventSummary'</a>, <a>eventSummary_eventTime</a> -
--   The time that the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:EventSummary'</a>, <a>eventSummary_eventType</a> -
--   The type of event. The timeline event must be <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventUpdatedTime:EventSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventSummary_eventUpdatedTime</a> - The time that the timeline
--   event was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:EventSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventSummary_incidentRecordArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the incident that the event happened during.
newEventSummary :: Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> EventSummary

-- | The timeline event ID.
eventSummary_eventId :: Lens' EventSummary Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
eventSummary_eventTime :: Lens' EventSummary UTCTime

-- | The type of event. The timeline event must be <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
eventSummary_eventType :: Lens' EventSummary Text

-- | The time that the timeline event was last updated.
eventSummary_eventUpdatedTime :: Lens' EventSummary UTCTime

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event happened
--   during.
eventSummary_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' EventSummary Text

-- | Filter the selection by using a condition.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: Condition -> Text -> Filter

-- | The condition accepts before or after a specified time, equal to a
--   string, or equal to an integer.
[$sel:condition:Filter'] :: Filter -> Condition

-- | The key that you're filtering on.
[$sel:key:Filter'] :: Filter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_condition</a> - The condition
--   accepts before or after a specified time, equal to a string, or equal
--   to an integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_key</a> - The key that you're
--   filtering on.
newFilter :: Condition -> Text -> Filter

-- | The condition accepts before or after a specified time, equal to a
--   string, or equal to an integer.
filter_condition :: Lens' Filter Condition

-- | The key that you're filtering on.
filter_key :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | The record of the incident that's created when an incident occurs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIncidentRecord</a> smart constructor.
data IncidentRecord
IncidentRecord' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ChatChannel -> Maybe [AutomationExecution] -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> Natural -> IncidentRecordSource -> Text -> POSIX -> IncidentRecordStatus -> Text -> IncidentRecord

-- | The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what is currently happening, and context.
[$sel:summary:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
[$sel:notificationTargets:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem]

-- | The time at which the incident was resolved. This appears as a
--   timeline event.
[$sel:resolvedTime:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The chat channel used for collaboration during an incident.
[$sel:chatChannel:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Maybe ChatChannel

-- | The runbook, or automation document, that's run at the beginning of
--   the incident.
[$sel:automationExecutions:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Maybe [AutomationExecution]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record.
[$sel:arn:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Text

-- | The time that Incident Manager created the incident record.
[$sel:creationTime:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> POSIX

-- | The string Incident Manager uses to prevent duplicate incidents from
--   being created by the same incident.
[$sel:dedupeString:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Text

-- | The impact of the incident on customers and applications.
[$sel:impact:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Natural

-- | Details about the action that started the incident.
[$sel:incidentRecordSource:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> IncidentRecordSource

-- | Who modified the incident most recently.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Text

-- | The time at which the incident was most recently modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the incident.
[$sel:status:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> IncidentRecordStatus

-- | The title of the incident.
[$sel:title:IncidentRecord'] :: IncidentRecord -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IncidentRecord</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:summary:IncidentRecord'</a>, <a>incidentRecord_summary</a> -
--   The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what is currently happening, and context.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTargets:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_notificationTargets</a> - The SNS targets that are
--   notified when updates are made to an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolvedTime:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_resolvedTime</a> - The time at which the incident
--   was resolved. This appears as a timeline event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chatChannel:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_chatChannel</a> - The chat channel used for
--   collaboration during an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:automationExecutions:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_automationExecutions</a> - The runbook, or
--   automation document, that's run at the beginning of the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:IncidentRecord'</a>, <a>incidentRecord_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_creationTime</a> - The time that Incident Manager
--   created the incident record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dedupeString:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_dedupeString</a> - The string Incident Manager uses
--   to prevent duplicate incidents from being created by the same
--   incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:IncidentRecord'</a>, <a>incidentRecord_impact</a> - The
--   impact of the incident on customers and applications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordSource:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_incidentRecordSource</a> - Details about the action
--   that started the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_lastModifiedBy</a> - Who modified the incident most
--   recently.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:IncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecord_lastModifiedTime</a> - The time at which the
--   incident was most recently modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:IncidentRecord'</a>, <a>incidentRecord_status</a> - The
--   current status of the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:IncidentRecord'</a>, <a>incidentRecord_title</a> - The
--   title of the incident.
newIncidentRecord :: Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> Natural -> IncidentRecordSource -> Text -> UTCTime -> IncidentRecordStatus -> Text -> IncidentRecord

-- | The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what is currently happening, and context.
incidentRecord_summary :: Lens' IncidentRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
incidentRecord_notificationTargets :: Lens' IncidentRecord (Maybe [NotificationTargetItem])

-- | The time at which the incident was resolved. This appears as a
--   timeline event.
incidentRecord_resolvedTime :: Lens' IncidentRecord (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The chat channel used for collaboration during an incident.
incidentRecord_chatChannel :: Lens' IncidentRecord (Maybe ChatChannel)

-- | The runbook, or automation document, that's run at the beginning of
--   the incident.
incidentRecord_automationExecutions :: Lens' IncidentRecord (Maybe [AutomationExecution])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record.
incidentRecord_arn :: Lens' IncidentRecord Text

-- | The time that Incident Manager created the incident record.
incidentRecord_creationTime :: Lens' IncidentRecord UTCTime

-- | The string Incident Manager uses to prevent duplicate incidents from
--   being created by the same incident.
incidentRecord_dedupeString :: Lens' IncidentRecord Text

-- | The impact of the incident on customers and applications.
incidentRecord_impact :: Lens' IncidentRecord Natural

-- | Details about the action that started the incident.
incidentRecord_incidentRecordSource :: Lens' IncidentRecord IncidentRecordSource

-- | Who modified the incident most recently.
incidentRecord_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' IncidentRecord Text

-- | The time at which the incident was most recently modified.
incidentRecord_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' IncidentRecord UTCTime

-- | The current status of the incident.
incidentRecord_status :: Lens' IncidentRecord IncidentRecordStatus

-- | The title of the incident.
incidentRecord_title :: Lens' IncidentRecord Text

-- | Details about how the incident record was created and when.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIncidentRecordSource</a> smart constructor.
data IncidentRecordSource
IncidentRecordSource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> IncidentRecordSource

-- | The principal the assumed the role specified of the
--   <tt>createdBy</tt>.
[$sel:invokedBy:IncidentRecordSource'] :: IncidentRecordSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource that caused the incident to be created.
[$sel:resourceArn:IncidentRecordSource'] :: IncidentRecordSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The principal that started the incident.
[$sel:createdBy:IncidentRecordSource'] :: IncidentRecordSource -> Text

-- | The service that started the incident. This can be manually created
--   from Incident Manager, automatically created using an AWS CloudWatch
--   alarm, or Amazon EventBridge event.
[$sel:source:IncidentRecordSource'] :: IncidentRecordSource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IncidentRecordSource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:invokedBy:IncidentRecordSource'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSource_invokedBy</a> - The principal the assumed the
--   role specified of the <tt>createdBy</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:IncidentRecordSource'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSource_resourceArn</a> - The resource that caused the
--   incident to be created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:IncidentRecordSource'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSource_createdBy</a> - The principal that started the
--   incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:IncidentRecordSource'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSource_source</a> - The service that started the
--   incident. This can be manually created from Incident Manager,
--   automatically created using an AWS CloudWatch alarm, or Amazon
--   EventBridge event.
newIncidentRecordSource :: Text -> Text -> IncidentRecordSource

-- | The principal the assumed the role specified of the
--   <tt>createdBy</tt>.
incidentRecordSource_invokedBy :: Lens' IncidentRecordSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource that caused the incident to be created.
incidentRecordSource_resourceArn :: Lens' IncidentRecordSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The principal that started the incident.
incidentRecordSource_createdBy :: Lens' IncidentRecordSource Text

-- | The service that started the incident. This can be manually created
--   from Incident Manager, automatically created using an AWS CloudWatch
--   alarm, or Amazon EventBridge event.
incidentRecordSource_source :: Lens' IncidentRecordSource Text

-- | Details describing an incident record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIncidentRecordSummary</a> smart constructor.
data IncidentRecordSummary
IncidentRecordSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Text -> POSIX -> Natural -> IncidentRecordSource -> IncidentRecordStatus -> Text -> IncidentRecordSummary

-- | The time the incident was resolved.
[$sel:resolvedTime:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident.
[$sel:arn:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> Text

-- | The time the incident was created.
[$sel:creationTime:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> POSIX

-- | Defines the impact to customers and applications.
[$sel:impact:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> Natural

-- | What caused Incident Manager to create the incident.
[$sel:incidentRecordSource:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> IncidentRecordSource

-- | The current status of the incident.
[$sel:status:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> IncidentRecordStatus

-- | The title of the incident. This value is either provided by the
--   response plan or overwritten on creation.
[$sel:title:IncidentRecordSummary'] :: IncidentRecordSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IncidentRecordSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resolvedTime:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_resolvedTime</a> - The time the incident was
--   resolved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_creationTime</a> - The time the incident was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_impact</a> - Defines the impact to customers
--   and applications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordSource:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_incidentRecordSource</a> - What caused
--   Incident Manager to create the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_status</a> - The current status of the
--   incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:IncidentRecordSummary'</a>,
--   <a>incidentRecordSummary_title</a> - The title of the incident. This
--   value is either provided by the response plan or overwritten on
--   creation.
newIncidentRecordSummary :: Text -> UTCTime -> Natural -> IncidentRecordSource -> IncidentRecordStatus -> Text -> IncidentRecordSummary

-- | The time the incident was resolved.
incidentRecordSummary_resolvedTime :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident.
incidentRecordSummary_arn :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary Text

-- | The time the incident was created.
incidentRecordSummary_creationTime :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary UTCTime

-- | Defines the impact to customers and applications.
incidentRecordSummary_impact :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary Natural

-- | What caused Incident Manager to create the incident.
incidentRecordSummary_incidentRecordSource :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary IncidentRecordSource

-- | The current status of the incident.
incidentRecordSummary_status :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary IncidentRecordStatus

-- | The title of the incident. This value is either provided by the
--   response plan or overwritten on creation.
incidentRecordSummary_title :: Lens' IncidentRecordSummary Text

-- | Basic details used in creating a response plan. The response plan is
--   then used to create an incident record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIncidentTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data IncidentTemplate
IncidentTemplate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem] -> Maybe Text -> Natural -> Text -> IncidentTemplate

-- | The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what's currently happening, and context.
[$sel:summary:IncidentTemplate'] :: IncidentTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
[$sel:notificationTargets:IncidentTemplate'] :: IncidentTemplate -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem]

-- | Used to stop Incident Manager from creating multiple incident records
--   for the same incident.
[$sel:dedupeString:IncidentTemplate'] :: IncidentTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | The impact of the incident on your customers and applications.
[$sel:impact:IncidentTemplate'] :: IncidentTemplate -> Natural

-- | The title of the incident.
[$sel:title:IncidentTemplate'] :: IncidentTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IncidentTemplate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:summary:IncidentTemplate'</a>, <a>incidentTemplate_summary</a>
--   - The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what's currently happening, and context.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTargets:IncidentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>incidentTemplate_notificationTargets</a> - The SNS targets that are
--   notified when updates are made to an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dedupeString:IncidentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>incidentTemplate_dedupeString</a> - Used to stop Incident Manager
--   from creating multiple incident records for the same incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:IncidentTemplate'</a>, <a>incidentTemplate_impact</a> -
--   The impact of the incident on your customers and applications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:IncidentTemplate'</a>, <a>incidentTemplate_title</a> -
--   The title of the incident.
newIncidentTemplate :: Natural -> Text -> IncidentTemplate

-- | The summary of the incident. The summary is a brief synopsis of what
--   occurred, what's currently happening, and context.
incidentTemplate_summary :: Lens' IncidentTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
incidentTemplate_notificationTargets :: Lens' IncidentTemplate (Maybe [NotificationTargetItem])

-- | Used to stop Incident Manager from creating multiple incident records
--   for the same incident.
incidentTemplate_dedupeString :: Lens' IncidentTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The impact of the incident on your customers and applications.
incidentTemplate_impact :: Lens' IncidentTemplate Natural

-- | The title of the incident.
incidentTemplate_title :: Lens' IncidentTemplate Text

-- | Details and type of a related item.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newItemIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data ItemIdentifier
ItemIdentifier' :: ItemType -> ItemValue -> ItemIdentifier

-- | The type of related item. Incident Manager supports the following
--   types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ANALYSIS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INCIDENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>METRIC</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PARENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ATTACHMENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OTHER</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ItemIdentifier'] :: ItemIdentifier -> ItemType

-- | Details about the related item.
[$sel:value:ItemIdentifier'] :: ItemIdentifier -> ItemValue

-- | Create a value of <a>ItemIdentifier</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ItemIdentifier'</a>, <a>itemIdentifier_type</a> - The
--   type of related item. Incident Manager supports the following types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ANALYSIS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INCIDENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>METRIC</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PARENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ATTACHMENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OTHER</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ItemIdentifier'</a>, <a>itemIdentifier_value</a> -
--   Details about the related item.
newItemIdentifier :: ItemType -> ItemValue -> ItemIdentifier

-- | The type of related item. Incident Manager supports the following
--   types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>ANALYSIS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INCIDENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>METRIC</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PARENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ATTACHMENT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OTHER</pre></li>
--   </ul>
itemIdentifier_type :: Lens' ItemIdentifier ItemType

-- | Details about the related item.
itemIdentifier_value :: Lens' ItemIdentifier ItemValue

-- | Describes a related item.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newItemValue</a> smart constructor.
data ItemValue
ItemValue' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ItemValue

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related item, if the related
--   item is an Amazon resource.
[$sel:arn:ItemValue'] :: ItemValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL, if the related item is a non-AWS resource.
[$sel:url:ItemValue'] :: ItemValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The metric definition, if the related item is a metric in CloudWatch.
[$sel:metricDefinition:ItemValue'] :: ItemValue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ItemValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ItemValue'</a>, <a>itemValue_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the related item, if the related item is an Amazon
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:ItemValue'</a>, <a>itemValue_url</a> - The URL, if the
--   related item is a non-AWS resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDefinition:ItemValue'</a>,
--   <a>itemValue_metricDefinition</a> - The metric definition, if the
--   related item is a metric in CloudWatch.
newItemValue :: ItemValue

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related item, if the related
--   item is an Amazon resource.
itemValue_arn :: Lens' ItemValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL, if the related item is a non-AWS resource.
itemValue_url :: Lens' ItemValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The metric definition, if the related item is a metric in CloudWatch.
itemValue_metricDefinition :: Lens' ItemValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationTargetItem</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationTargetItem
NotificationTargetItem' :: Maybe Text -> NotificationTargetItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
[$sel:snsTopicArn:NotificationTargetItem'] :: NotificationTargetItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationTargetItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicArn:NotificationTargetItem'</a>,
--   <a>notificationTargetItem_snsTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the SNS topic.
newNotificationTargetItem :: NotificationTargetItem

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
notificationTargetItem_snsTopicArn :: Lens' NotificationTargetItem (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a Region in your replication set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegionInfo</a> smart constructor.
data RegionInfo
RegionInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RegionStatus -> POSIX -> RegionInfo

-- | Information displayed about the status of the Region.
[$sel:statusMessage:RegionInfo'] :: RegionInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the data in this Region.
[$sel:sseKmsKeyId:RegionInfo'] :: RegionInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the Region in the replication set.
[$sel:status:RegionInfo'] :: RegionInfo -> RegionStatus

-- | The most recent date and time that the Region's status was updated.
[$sel:statusUpdateDateTime:RegionInfo'] :: RegionInfo -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>RegionInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:RegionInfo'</a>, <a>regionInfo_statusMessage</a>
--   - Information displayed about the status of the Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sseKmsKeyId:RegionInfo'</a>, <a>regionInfo_sseKmsKeyId</a> -
--   The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the data in this Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RegionInfo'</a>, <a>regionInfo_status</a> - The status
--   of the Region in the replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusUpdateDateTime:RegionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>regionInfo_statusUpdateDateTime</a> - The most recent date and time
--   that the Region's status was updated.
newRegionInfo :: RegionStatus -> UTCTime -> RegionInfo

-- | Information displayed about the status of the Region.
regionInfo_statusMessage :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the data in this Region.
regionInfo_sseKmsKeyId :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the Region in the replication set.
regionInfo_status :: Lens' RegionInfo RegionStatus

-- | The most recent date and time that the Region's status was updated.
regionInfo_statusUpdateDateTime :: Lens' RegionInfo UTCTime

-- | The mapping between a Region and the key that's used to encrypt the
--   data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegionMapInputValue</a> smart constructor.
data RegionMapInputValue
RegionMapInputValue' :: Maybe Text -> RegionMapInputValue

-- | The KMS key used to encrypt the data in your replication set.
[$sel:sseKmsKeyId:RegionMapInputValue'] :: RegionMapInputValue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegionMapInputValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sseKmsKeyId:RegionMapInputValue'</a>,
--   <a>regionMapInputValue_sseKmsKeyId</a> - The KMS key used to encrypt
--   the data in your replication set.
newRegionMapInputValue :: RegionMapInputValue

-- | The KMS key used to encrypt the data in your replication set.
regionMapInputValue_sseKmsKeyId :: Lens' RegionMapInputValue (Maybe Text)

-- | Resources that responders use to triage and mitigate the incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelatedItem</a> smart constructor.
data RelatedItem
RelatedItem' :: Maybe Text -> ItemIdentifier -> RelatedItem

-- | The title of the related item.
[$sel:title:RelatedItem'] :: RelatedItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Details about the related item.
[$sel:identifier:RelatedItem'] :: RelatedItem -> ItemIdentifier

-- | Create a value of <a>RelatedItem</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:RelatedItem'</a>, <a>relatedItem_title</a> - The title
--   of the related item.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:RelatedItem'</a>, <a>relatedItem_identifier</a> -
--   Details about the related item.
newRelatedItem :: ItemIdentifier -> RelatedItem

-- | The title of the related item.
relatedItem_title :: Lens' RelatedItem (Maybe Text)

-- | Details about the related item.
relatedItem_identifier :: Lens' RelatedItem ItemIdentifier

-- | Details about the related item you're adding.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelatedItemsUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data RelatedItemsUpdate
RelatedItemsUpdate' :: Maybe ItemIdentifier -> Maybe RelatedItem -> RelatedItemsUpdate

-- | Details about the related item you're deleting.
[$sel:itemToRemove:RelatedItemsUpdate'] :: RelatedItemsUpdate -> Maybe ItemIdentifier

-- | Details about the related item you're adding.
[$sel:itemToAdd:RelatedItemsUpdate'] :: RelatedItemsUpdate -> Maybe RelatedItem

-- | Create a value of <a>RelatedItemsUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:itemToRemove:RelatedItemsUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>relatedItemsUpdate_itemToRemove</a> - Details about the related
--   item you're deleting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:itemToAdd:RelatedItemsUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>relatedItemsUpdate_itemToAdd</a> - Details about the related item
--   you're adding.
newRelatedItemsUpdate :: RelatedItemsUpdate

-- | Details about the related item you're deleting.
relatedItemsUpdate_itemToRemove :: Lens' RelatedItemsUpdate (Maybe ItemIdentifier)

-- | Details about the related item you're adding.
relatedItemsUpdate_itemToAdd :: Lens' RelatedItemsUpdate (Maybe RelatedItem)

-- | The set of Regions that your Incident Manager data will be replicated
--   to and the KMS key used to encrypt the data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationSet</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationSet
ReplicationSet' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> POSIX -> Bool -> Text -> POSIX -> HashMap Text RegionInfo -> ReplicationSetStatus -> ReplicationSet

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set.
[$sel:arn:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> Maybe Text

-- | Details about who created the replication set.
[$sel:createdBy:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> Text

-- | When the replication set was created.
[$sel:createdTime:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> POSIX

-- | Determines if the replication set deletion protection is enabled or
--   not. If deletion protection is enabled, you can't delete the last
--   Region in the replication set.
[$sel:deletionProtected:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> Bool

-- | Who last modified the replication set.
[$sel:lastModifiedBy:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> Text

-- | When the replication set was last updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> POSIX

-- | The map between each Region in your replication set and the KMS key
--   that is used to encrypt the data in that Region.
[$sel:regionMap:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> HashMap Text RegionInfo

-- | The status of the replication set. If the replication set is still
--   pending, you can't use Incident Manager functionality.
[$sel:status:ReplicationSet'] :: ReplicationSet -> ReplicationSetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ReplicationSet'</a>, <a>replicationSet_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:ReplicationSet'</a>, <a>replicationSet_createdBy</a>
--   - Details about who created the replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:ReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSet_createdTime</a> - When the replication set was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deletionProtected:ReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSet_deletionProtected</a> - Determines if the
--   replication set deletion protection is enabled or not. If deletion
--   protection is enabled, you can't delete the last Region in the
--   replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedBy:ReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSet_lastModifiedBy</a> - Who last modified the
--   replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:ReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>replicationSet_lastModifiedTime</a> - When the replication set was
--   last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionMap:ReplicationSet'</a>, <a>replicationSet_regionMap</a>
--   - The map between each Region in your replication set and the KMS key
--   that is used to encrypt the data in that Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationSet'</a>, <a>replicationSet_status</a> - The
--   status of the replication set. If the replication set is still
--   pending, you can't use Incident Manager functionality.
newReplicationSet :: Text -> UTCTime -> Bool -> Text -> UTCTime -> ReplicationSetStatus -> ReplicationSet

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set.
replicationSet_arn :: Lens' ReplicationSet (Maybe Text)

-- | Details about who created the replication set.
replicationSet_createdBy :: Lens' ReplicationSet Text

-- | When the replication set was created.
replicationSet_createdTime :: Lens' ReplicationSet UTCTime

-- | Determines if the replication set deletion protection is enabled or
--   not. If deletion protection is enabled, you can't delete the last
--   Region in the replication set.
replicationSet_deletionProtected :: Lens' ReplicationSet Bool

-- | Who last modified the replication set.
replicationSet_lastModifiedBy :: Lens' ReplicationSet Text

-- | When the replication set was last updated.
replicationSet_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' ReplicationSet UTCTime

-- | The map between each Region in your replication set and the KMS key
--   that is used to encrypt the data in that Region.
replicationSet_regionMap :: Lens' ReplicationSet (HashMap Text RegionInfo)

-- | The status of the replication set. If the replication set is still
--   pending, you can't use Incident Manager functionality.
replicationSet_status :: Lens' ReplicationSet ReplicationSetStatus

-- | The resource policy that allows Incident Manager to perform actions on
--   resources on your behalf.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourcePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ResourcePolicy
ResourcePolicy' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResourcePolicy

-- | The JSON blob that describes the policy.
[$sel:policyDocument:ResourcePolicy'] :: ResourcePolicy -> Text

-- | The ID of the resource policy.
[$sel:policyId:ResourcePolicy'] :: ResourcePolicy -> Text

-- | The Region that policy allows resources to be used in.
[$sel:ramResourceShareRegion:ResourcePolicy'] :: ResourcePolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourcePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyDocument:ResourcePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>resourcePolicy_policyDocument</a> - The JSON blob that describes
--   the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:ResourcePolicy'</a>, <a>resourcePolicy_policyId</a> -
--   The ID of the resource policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramResourceShareRegion:ResourcePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>resourcePolicy_ramResourceShareRegion</a> - The Region that policy
--   allows resources to be used in.
newResourcePolicy :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResourcePolicy

-- | The JSON blob that describes the policy.
resourcePolicy_policyDocument :: Lens' ResourcePolicy Text

-- | The ID of the resource policy.
resourcePolicy_policyId :: Lens' ResourcePolicy Text

-- | The Region that policy allows resources to be used in.
resourcePolicy_ramResourceShareRegion :: Lens' ResourcePolicy Text

-- | Details of the response plan that are used when creating an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResponsePlanSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ResponsePlanSummary
ResponsePlanSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ResponsePlanSummary

-- | The human readable name of the response plan. This can include spaces.
[$sel:displayName:ResponsePlanSummary'] :: ResponsePlanSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
[$sel:arn:ResponsePlanSummary'] :: ResponsePlanSummary -> Text

-- | The name of the response plan. This can't include spaces.
[$sel:name:ResponsePlanSummary'] :: ResponsePlanSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResponsePlanSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:ResponsePlanSummary'</a>,
--   <a>responsePlanSummary_displayName</a> - The human readable name of
--   the response plan. This can include spaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ResponsePlanSummary'</a>, <a>responsePlanSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ResponsePlanSummary'</a>, <a>responsePlanSummary_name</a>
--   - The name of the response plan. This can't include spaces.
newResponsePlanSummary :: Text -> Text -> ResponsePlanSummary

-- | The human readable name of the response plan. This can include spaces.
responsePlanSummary_displayName :: Lens' ResponsePlanSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
responsePlanSummary_arn :: Lens' ResponsePlanSummary Text

-- | The name of the response plan. This can't include spaces.
responsePlanSummary_name :: Lens' ResponsePlanSummary Text

-- | Details about the Systems Manager automation document that will be
--   used as a runbook during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSsmAutomation</a> smart constructor.
data SsmAutomation
SsmAutomation' :: Maybe SsmTargetAccount -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> SsmAutomation

-- | The account that the automation document will be run in. This can be
--   in either the management account or an application account.
[$sel:targetAccount:SsmAutomation'] :: SsmAutomation -> Maybe SsmTargetAccount

-- | The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation
--   document.
[$sel:parameters:SsmAutomation'] :: SsmAutomation -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The automation document's version to use when running.
[$sel:documentVersion:SsmAutomation'] :: SsmAutomation -> Maybe Text

-- | The automation document's name.
[$sel:documentName:SsmAutomation'] :: SsmAutomation -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation
--   document will assume when running commands.
[$sel:roleArn:SsmAutomation'] :: SsmAutomation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SsmAutomation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAccount:SsmAutomation'</a>,
--   <a>ssmAutomation_targetAccount</a> - The account that the automation
--   document will be run in. This can be in either the management account
--   or an application account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:SsmAutomation'</a>, <a>ssmAutomation_parameters</a>
--   - The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentVersion:SsmAutomation'</a>,
--   <a>ssmAutomation_documentVersion</a> - The automation document's
--   version to use when running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentName:SsmAutomation'</a>,
--   <a>ssmAutomation_documentName</a> - The automation document's name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:SsmAutomation'</a>, <a>ssmAutomation_roleArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation document
--   will assume when running commands.
newSsmAutomation :: Text -> Text -> SsmAutomation

-- | The account that the automation document will be run in. This can be
--   in either the management account or an application account.
ssmAutomation_targetAccount :: Lens' SsmAutomation (Maybe SsmTargetAccount)

-- | The key-value pair parameters to use when running the automation
--   document.
ssmAutomation_parameters :: Lens' SsmAutomation (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The automation document's version to use when running.
ssmAutomation_documentVersion :: Lens' SsmAutomation (Maybe Text)

-- | The automation document's name.
ssmAutomation_documentName :: Lens' SsmAutomation Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the automation
--   document will assume when running commands.
ssmAutomation_roleArn :: Lens' SsmAutomation Text

-- | A significant event that happened during the incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimelineEvent</a> smart constructor.
data TimelineEvent
TimelineEvent' :: Text -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> TimelineEvent

-- | A short description of the event.
[$sel:eventData:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The ID of the timeline event.
[$sel:eventId:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
[$sel:eventTime:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> POSIX

-- | The type of event that occurred. Currently Incident Manager supports
--   only the <tt>Custom Event</tt> type.
[$sel:eventType:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The time that the timeline event was last updated.
[$sel:eventUpdatedTime:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event occurred
--   during.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:TimelineEvent'] :: TimelineEvent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TimelineEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventData:TimelineEvent'</a>, <a>timelineEvent_eventData</a> -
--   A short description of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:TimelineEvent'</a>, <a>timelineEvent_eventId</a> - The
--   ID of the timeline event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTime:TimelineEvent'</a>, <a>timelineEvent_eventTime</a> -
--   The time that the event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:TimelineEvent'</a>, <a>timelineEvent_eventType</a> -
--   The type of event that occurred. Currently Incident Manager supports
--   only the <tt>Custom Event</tt> type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventUpdatedTime:TimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>timelineEvent_eventUpdatedTime</a> - The time that the timeline
--   event was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:TimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>timelineEvent_incidentRecordArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the incident that the event occurred during.
newTimelineEvent :: Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> TimelineEvent

-- | A short description of the event.
timelineEvent_eventData :: Lens' TimelineEvent Text

-- | The ID of the timeline event.
timelineEvent_eventId :: Lens' TimelineEvent Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
timelineEvent_eventTime :: Lens' TimelineEvent UTCTime

-- | The type of event that occurred. Currently Incident Manager supports
--   only the <tt>Custom Event</tt> type.
timelineEvent_eventType :: Lens' TimelineEvent Text

-- | The time that the timeline event was last updated.
timelineEvent_eventUpdatedTime :: Lens' TimelineEvent UTCTime

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event occurred
--   during.
timelineEvent_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' TimelineEvent Text

-- | Details about what caused the incident to be created in Incident
--   Manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTriggerDetails</a> smart constructor.
data TriggerDetails
TriggerDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> POSIX -> TriggerDetails

-- | Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
[$sel:rawData:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the source that detected the incident.
[$sel:triggerArn:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
[$sel:source:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> Text

-- | The time that the incident was detected.
[$sel:timestamp:TriggerDetails'] :: TriggerDetails -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TriggerDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rawData:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_rawData</a> -
--   Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:triggerArn:TriggerDetails'</a>,
--   <a>triggerDetails_triggerArn</a> - The ARN of the source that detected
--   the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_source</a> -
--   Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:TriggerDetails'</a>, <a>triggerDetails_timestamp</a>
--   - The time that the incident was detected.
newTriggerDetails :: Text -> UTCTime -> TriggerDetails

-- | Raw data passed from either EventBridge, CloudWatch, or Incident
--   Manager when an incident is created.
triggerDetails_rawData :: Lens' TriggerDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the source that detected the incident.
triggerDetails_triggerArn :: Lens' TriggerDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the service that sourced the event. All events sourced from
--   within AWS begin with "aws." Customer-generated events can have any
--   value here, as long as it doesn't begin with "aws." We recommend the
--   use of Java package-name style reverse domain-name strings.
triggerDetails_source :: Lens' TriggerDetails Text

-- | The time that the incident was detected.
triggerDetails_timestamp :: Lens' TriggerDetails UTCTime

-- | Details used when updating the replication set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateReplicationSetAction</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateReplicationSetAction
UpdateReplicationSetAction' :: Maybe AddRegionAction -> Maybe DeleteRegionAction -> UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're adding to the replication set.
[$sel:addRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'] :: UpdateReplicationSetAction -> Maybe AddRegionAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
[$sel:deleteRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'] :: UpdateReplicationSetAction -> Maybe DeleteRegionAction

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateReplicationSetAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:addRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateReplicationSetAction_addRegionAction</a> - Details about the
--   Region that you're adding to the replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteRegionAction:UpdateReplicationSetAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateReplicationSetAction_deleteRegionAction</a> - Details about
--   the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
newUpdateReplicationSetAction :: UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | Details about the Region that you're adding to the replication set.
updateReplicationSetAction_addRegionAction :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSetAction (Maybe AddRegionAction)

-- | Details about the Region that you're deleting to the replication set.
updateReplicationSetAction_deleteRegionAction :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSetAction (Maybe DeleteRegionAction)


-- | Adds a tag to a response plan.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan you're adding the
--   tags to.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the response plan.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan you're adding the
--   tags to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you are adding to the response plan.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan you're adding the
--   tags to.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the response plan.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>tagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newTagResourceResponse :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.TagResource.TagResource


-- | Used to start an incident from CloudWatch alarms, EventBridge events,
--   or manually.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.StartIncident

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartIncident</a> smart constructor.
data StartIncident
StartIncident' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TriggerDetails -> Maybe [RelatedItem] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Text -> StartIncident

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Maybe Text

-- | Details of what created the incident record in Incident Manager.
[$sel:triggerDetails:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Maybe TriggerDetails

-- | Add related items to the incident for other responders to use. Related
--   items are AWS resources, external links, or files uploaded to an S3
--   bucket.
[$sel:relatedItems:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Maybe [RelatedItem]

-- | Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites
--   the impact provided by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but
--   urgent action is needed to avoid impact.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:impact:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Maybe Natural

-- | Provide a title for the incident. Providing a title overwrites the
--   title provided by the response plan.
[$sel:title:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan that pre-defines
--   summary, chat channels, SNS topics, runbooks, title, and impact of the
--   incident.
[$sel:responsePlanArn:StartIncident'] :: StartIncident -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartIncident</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:StartIncident'</a>,
--   <a>startIncident_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the action is
--   called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:triggerDetails:StartIncident'</a>,
--   <a>startIncident_triggerDetails</a> - Details of what created the
--   incident record in Incident Manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedItems:StartIncident'</a>,
--   <a>startIncident_relatedItems</a> - Add related items to the incident
--   for other responders to use. Related items are AWS resources, external
--   links, or files uploaded to an S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:StartIncident'</a>, <a>startIncident_impact</a> -
--   Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites
--   the impact provided by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but
--   urgent action is needed to avoid impact.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:StartIncident'</a>, <a>startIncident_title</a> - Provide
--   a title for the incident. Providing a title overwrites the title
--   provided by the response plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responsePlanArn:StartIncident'</a>,
--   <a>startIncident_responsePlanArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the response plan that pre-defines summary, chat channels, SNS
--   topics, runbooks, title, and impact of the incident.
newStartIncident :: Text -> StartIncident

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
startIncident_clientToken :: Lens' StartIncident (Maybe Text)

-- | Details of what created the incident record in Incident Manager.
startIncident_triggerDetails :: Lens' StartIncident (Maybe TriggerDetails)

-- | Add related items to the incident for other responders to use. Related
--   items are AWS resources, external links, or files uploaded to an S3
--   bucket.
startIncident_relatedItems :: Lens' StartIncident (Maybe [RelatedItem])

-- | Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites
--   the impact provided by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but
--   urgent action is needed to avoid impact.</li>
--   </ul>
startIncident_impact :: Lens' StartIncident (Maybe Natural)

-- | Provide a title for the incident. Providing a title overwrites the
--   title provided by the response plan.
startIncident_title :: Lens' StartIncident (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan that pre-defines
--   summary, chat channels, SNS topics, runbooks, title, and impact of the
--   incident.
startIncident_responsePlanArn :: Lens' StartIncident Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartIncidentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartIncidentResponse
StartIncidentResponse' :: Int -> Text -> StartIncidentResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StartIncidentResponse'] :: StartIncidentResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the newly created incident record.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:StartIncidentResponse'] :: StartIncidentResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartIncidentResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
