--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartIncidentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startIncidentResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:StartIncidentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startIncidentResponse_incidentRecordArn</a> - The ARN of the newly
--   created incident record.
newStartIncidentResponse :: Int -> Text -> StartIncidentResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
startIncidentResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartIncidentResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the newly created incident record.
startIncidentResponse_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' StartIncidentResponse Text

-- | Lists timeline events of the specified incident record.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.ListTimelineEvents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTimelineEvents</a> smart constructor.
data ListTimelineEvents
ListTimelineEvents' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe SortOrder -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe TimelineEventSort -> Text -> ListTimelineEvents

-- | Filters the timeline events based on the provided conditional values.
--   You can filter timeline events using the following keys:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>eventTime</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventType</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filters:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Maybe [Filter]

-- | Sorts the order of timeline events by the value specified in the
--   <tt>sortBy</tt> field.
[$sel:sortOrder:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Maybe SortOrder

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Maybe Natural

-- | Sort by the specified key value pair.
[$sel:sortBy:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Maybe TimelineEventSort

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event is part
--   of.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:ListTimelineEvents'] :: ListTimelineEvents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTimelineEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_filters</a> - Filters the timeline events based
--   on the provided conditional values. You can filter timeline events
--   using the following keys:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>eventTime</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventType</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortOrder:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_sortOrder</a> - Sorts the order of timeline
--   events by the value specified in the <tt>sortBy</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to continue
--   to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_sortBy</a> - Sort by the specified key value
--   pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:ListTimelineEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listTimelineEvents_incidentRecordArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the incident that the event is part of.
newListTimelineEvents :: Text -> ListTimelineEvents

-- | Filters the timeline events based on the provided conditional values.
--   You can filter timeline events using the following keys:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>eventTime</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventType</pre></li>
--   </ul>
listTimelineEvents_filters :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents (Maybe [Filter])

-- | Sorts the order of timeline events by the value specified in the
--   <tt>sortBy</tt> field.
listTimelineEvents_sortOrder :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents (Maybe SortOrder)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listTimelineEvents_nextToken :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results per page.
listTimelineEvents_maxResults :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents (Maybe Natural)

-- | Sort by the specified key value pair.
listTimelineEvents_sortBy :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents (Maybe TimelineEventSort)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the event is part
--   of.
listTimelineEvents_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' ListTimelineEvents Text

-- | Lists all response plans in your account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.ListResponsePlans

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListResponsePlans</a> smart constructor.
data ListResponsePlans

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.

-- | The maximum number of response plans per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListResponsePlans'] :: ListResponsePlans -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListResponsePlans</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

-- | Lists all incident records in your account. Use this command to
--   retrieve the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record you
--   want to update.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.ListIncidentRecords

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListIncidentRecords</a> smart constructor.
data ListIncidentRecords
ListIncidentRecords' :: Maybe [Filter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListIncidentRecords

-- | Filter the list of incident records you are searching through. You can
--   filter on the following keys:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>creationTime</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>impact</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>status</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>createdBy</pre></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Retrieves the details of the specified response plan.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.GetResponsePlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResponsePlan</a> smart constructor.
data GetResponsePlan
GetResponsePlan' :: Text -> GetResponsePlan

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.

-- | Create a value of <a>GetResponsePlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:GetResponsePlan'</a>, <a>getResponsePlan_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
newGetResponsePlan :: Text -> GetResponsePlan

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
getResponsePlan_arn :: Lens' GetResponsePlan Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResponsePlanResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetResponsePlanResponse
GetResponsePlanResponse' :: Maybe [Action] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChatChannel -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> Text -> IncidentTemplate -> Text -> GetResponsePlanResponse

-- | The actions that this response plan takes at the beginning of the
--   incident.
[$sel:actions:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Maybe [Action]

-- | The long format name of the response plan. Can contain spaces.
[$sel:displayName:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an
--   incident.
[$sel:chatChannel:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Maybe ChatChannel

-- | The contacts and escalation plans that the response plan engages
--   during an incident.
[$sel:engagements:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the response plan.
[$sel:arn:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Text

-- | Details used to create the incident when using this response plan.
[$sel:incidentTemplate:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> IncidentTemplate

-- | The short format name of the response plan. Can't contain spaces.
[$sel:name:GetResponsePlanResponse'] :: GetResponsePlanResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetResponsePlanResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResponsePlanResponse_actions</a> - The actions that this
--   response plan takes at the beginning of the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResponsePlanResponse_displayName</a> - The long format name of
--   the response plan. Can contain spaces.

--   <a>$sel:chatChannel:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,

--   <a>$sel:engagements:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResponsePlanResponse_engagements</a> - The contacts and
--   escalation plans that the response plan engages during an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResponsePlanResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:GetResponsePlan'</a>, <a>getResponsePlanResponse_arn</a> -
--   The ARN of the response plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplate:GetResponsePlanResponse'</a>,

--   create the incident when using this response plan.

--   response plan. Can't contain spaces.

--   incident.

-- | Retrieves the resource policies attached to the specified response
--   plan.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.GetResourcePolicies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResourcePolicies</a> smart constructor.
data GetResourcePolicies
GetResourcePolicies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> GetResourcePolicies

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:GetResourcePolicies'] :: GetResourcePolicies -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of resource policies to display per page of
--   results.
[$sel:maxResults:GetResourcePolicies'] :: GetResourcePolicies -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan with the attached
--   resource policy.
[$sel:resourceArn:GetResourcePolicies'] :: GetResourcePolicies -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetResourcePolicies</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetResourcePolicies'</a>,
--   <a>getResourcePolicies_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of resource
--   policies to display per page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:GetResourcePolicies'</a>,
--   <a>getResourcePolicies_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the response plan with the attached resource policy.

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.

-- | The maximum number of resource policies to display per page of
--   results.
getResourcePolicies_maxResults :: Lens' GetResourcePolicies (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan with the attached
--   resource policy.
getResourcePolicies_resourceArn :: Lens' GetResourcePolicies Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResourcePoliciesResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Deletes the specified response plan. Deleting a response plan stops
--   all linked CloudWatch alarms and EventBridge events from creating an
--   incident with this response plan.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.DeleteResponsePlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteResponsePlan</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteResponsePlan
DeleteResponsePlan' :: Text -> DeleteResponsePlan

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
[$sel:arn:DeleteResponsePlan'] :: DeleteResponsePlan -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteResponsePlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DeleteResponsePlan'</a>, <a>deleteResponsePlan_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
newDeleteResponsePlan :: Text -> DeleteResponsePlan

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
deleteResponsePlan_arn :: Lens' DeleteResponsePlan Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteResponsePlanResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteResponsePlanResponse
DeleteResponsePlanResponse' :: Int -> DeleteResponsePlanResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteResponsePlanResponse'] :: DeleteResponsePlanResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteResponsePlanResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteResponsePlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteResponsePlanResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeleteResponsePlanResponse :: Int -> DeleteResponsePlanResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteResponsePlanResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteResponsePlanResponse Int

-- | Creates a custom timeline event on the incident details page of an
--   incident record. Timeline events are automatically created by Incident
--   Manager, marking key moment during an incident. You can create custom
--   timeline events to mark important events that are automatically
--   detected by Incident Manager.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.CreateTimelineEvent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTimelineEvent</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTimelineEvent
CreateTimelineEvent' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> POSIX -> Text -> Text -> CreateTimelineEvent

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateTimelineEvent'] :: CreateTimelineEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | A valid JSON string. There is no other schema imposed. A short
--   description of the event.
[$sel:eventData:CreateTimelineEvent'] :: CreateTimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
[$sel:eventTime:CreateTimelineEvent'] :: CreateTimelineEvent -> POSIX

-- | The type of the event. You can create timeline events of type
--   <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
[$sel:eventType:CreateTimelineEvent'] :: CreateTimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record you are adding
--   the event to.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:CreateTimelineEvent'] :: CreateTimelineEvent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTimelineEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>createTimelineEvent_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   action is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventData:CreateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>createTimelineEvent_eventData</a> - A valid JSON string. There is
--   no other schema imposed. A short description of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTime:CreateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>createTimelineEvent_eventTime</a> - The time that the event
--   occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:CreateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>createTimelineEvent_eventType</a> - The type of the event. You can
--   create timeline events of type <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:CreateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>createTimelineEvent_incidentRecordArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the incident record you are adding the event to.
newCreateTimelineEvent :: Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> CreateTimelineEvent

--   specified details.
createTimelineEvent_clientToken :: Lens' CreateTimelineEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | A valid JSON string. There is no other schema imposed. A short
--   description of the event.
createTimelineEvent_eventData :: Lens' CreateTimelineEvent Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
createTimelineEvent_eventTime :: Lens' CreateTimelineEvent UTCTime

-- | The type of the event. You can create timeline events of type
--   <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
createTimelineEvent_eventType :: Lens' CreateTimelineEvent Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record you are adding
--   the event to.
createTimelineEvent_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' CreateTimelineEvent Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTimelineEventResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTimelineEventResponse
CreateTimelineEventResponse' :: Int -> Text -> Text -> CreateTimelineEventResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:CreateTimelineEventResponse'] :: CreateTimelineEventResponse -> Int

-- | Creates a response plan that automates the initial response to
--   incidents. A response plan engages contacts, starts chat channel
--   collaboration, and initiates runbooks at the beginning of an incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.CreateResponsePlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateResponsePlan</a> smart constructor.
data CreateResponsePlan
CreateResponsePlan' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Action] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChatChannel -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> IncidentTemplate -> Text -> CreateResponsePlan

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The actions that the response plan starts at the beginning of an
--   incident.
[$sel:actions:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe [Action]

-- | The long format of the response plan name. This field can contain
--   spaces.
[$sel:displayName:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an
--   incident.
[$sel:chatChannel:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe ChatChannel

-- | The contacts and escalation plans that the response plan engages
--   during an incident.
[$sel:engagements:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the response plan.
[$sel:tags:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Details used to create an incident when using this response plan.
[$sel:incidentTemplate:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> IncidentTemplate

-- | The short format name of the response plan. Can't include spaces.
[$sel:name:CreateResponsePlan'] :: CreateResponsePlan -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateResponsePlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>createResponsePlan_actions</a> - The actions that the response plan
--   starts at the beginning of an incident.

--   <a>$sel:displayName:CreateResponsePlan'</a>,

--   response plan name. This field can contain spaces.

--   incident when using this response plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateResponsePlan'</a>, <a>createResponsePlan_name</a> -
--   The short format name of the response plan. Can't include spaces.
newCreateResponsePlan :: IncidentTemplate -> Text -> CreateResponsePlan

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createResponsePlan_clientToken :: Lens' CreateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

--   incident.

--   spaces.

--   during an incident.

-- | The short format name of the response plan. Can't include spaces.
createResponsePlan_name :: Lens' CreateResponsePlan Text

-- | A replication set replicates and encrypts your data to the provided
--   Regions with the provided KMS key.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.CreateReplicationSet

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateReplicationSet</a> smart constructor.
data CreateReplicationSet
CreateReplicationSet' :: Maybe Text -> HashMap Text RegionMapInputValue -> CreateReplicationSet

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateReplicationSet'] :: CreateReplicationSet -> Maybe Text

-- | The Regions that Incident Manager replicates your data to. You can
--   have up to three Regions in your replication set.
[$sel:regions:CreateReplicationSet'] :: CreateReplicationSet -> HashMap Text RegionMapInputValue

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateReplicationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationSet_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   action is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regions:CreateReplicationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createReplicationSet_regions</a> - The Regions that Incident
--   Manager replicates your data to. You can have up to three Regions in
--   your replication set.
newCreateReplicationSet :: CreateReplicationSet

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createReplicationSet_clientToken :: Lens' CreateReplicationSet (Maybe Text)

-- | The Regions that Incident Manager replicates your data to. You can
--   have up to three Regions in your replication set.
createReplicationSet_regions :: Lens' CreateReplicationSet (HashMap Text RegionMapInputValue)

-- | Update the details of an incident record. You can use this action to
--   update an incident record from the defined chat channel. For more
--   information about using actions in chat channels, see <a>Interacting
--   through chat</a>.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.UpdateIncidentRecord

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateIncidentRecord</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateIncidentRecord
UpdateIncidentRecord' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe IncidentRecordStatus -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ChatChannel -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateIncidentRecord

-- | The summary describes what has happened during the incident.
[$sel:summary:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the incident. An incident can be <tt>Open</tt> or
--   <tt>Resolved</tt>.
[$sel:status:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe IncidentRecordStatus

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
--   
--   Using multiple SNS topics creates redundancy in the case that a Region
--   is down during the incident.
[$sel:notificationTargets:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem]

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | Defines the impact to customers and applications. Providing an impact
--   overwrites the impact provided by the response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but
--   urgent action is needed to avoid impact.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:impact:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe Natural

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel for responders to collaborate in.
[$sel:chatChannel:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe ChatChannel

-- | The title of the incident is a brief and easily recognizable.
[$sel:title:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record you are
--   updating.
[$sel:arn:UpdateIncidentRecord'] :: UpdateIncidentRecord -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateIncidentRecord</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:summary:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_summary</a> - The summary describes what has
--   happened during the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_status</a> - The status of the incident. An
--   incident can be <tt>Open</tt> or <tt>Resolved</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTargets:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_notificationTargets</a> - The SNS targets that
--   are notified when updates are made to an incident.
--   
--   Using multiple SNS topics creates redundancy in the case that a Region
--   is down during the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   action is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_impact</a> - Defines the impact to customers
--   and applications. Providing an impact overwrites the impact provided
--   by the response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but
--   urgent action is needed to avoid impact.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:chatChannel:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_chatChannel</a> - The AWS Chatbot chat channel
--   for responders to collaborate in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>,
--   <a>updateIncidentRecord_title</a> - The title of the incident is a
--   brief and easily recognizable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateIncidentRecord'</a>, <a>updateIncidentRecord_arn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident record you are
--   updating.
newUpdateIncidentRecord :: Text -> UpdateIncidentRecord

-- | The summary describes what has happened during the incident.
updateIncidentRecord_summary :: Lens' UpdateIncidentRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the incident. An incident can be <tt>Open</tt> or
--   <tt>Resolved</tt>.
updateIncidentRecord_status :: Lens' UpdateIncidentRecord (Maybe IncidentRecordStatus)

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
--   
--   Using multiple SNS topics creates redundancy in the case that a Region
--   is down during the incident.

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.

-- | Defines the impact to customers and applications. Providing an impact
--   overwrites the impact provided by the response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - Critical impact, this typically relates to full
--   application failure that impacts many to all customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - High impact, partial application failure with impact
--   to many customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact, the application is providing reduced
--   service to customers.</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - Low impact, customer might aren't impacted by the
--   problem yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - No impact, customers aren't currently impacted but

-- | Add or delete Regions from your replication set.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.UpdateReplicationSet

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateReplicationSet</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateReplicationSet
UpdateReplicationSet' :: Maybe Text -> NonEmpty UpdateReplicationSetAction -> Text -> UpdateReplicationSet

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateReplicationSet'] :: UpdateReplicationSet -> Maybe Text

-- | An action to add or delete a Region.
[$sel:actions:UpdateReplicationSet'] :: UpdateReplicationSet -> NonEmpty UpdateReplicationSetAction

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set you're updating.
[$sel:arn:UpdateReplicationSet'] :: UpdateReplicationSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateReplicationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   <a>updateReplicationSet_actions</a> - An action to add or delete a
--   Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateReplicationSet'</a>, <a>updateReplicationSet_arn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set you're
--   updating.

--   specified details.
updateReplicationSet_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSet (Maybe Text)

updateReplicationSet_actions :: Lens' UpdateReplicationSet (NonEmpty UpdateReplicationSetAction)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication set you're updating.

-- | Updates the specified response plan.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.UpdateResponsePlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateResponsePlan</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateResponsePlan
UpdateResponsePlan' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Action] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChatChannel -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem] -> Text -> UpdateResponsePlan

-- | Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites
--   the impact provided by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - Severe impact</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - High impact</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - Low impact</li>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - No impact</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:incidentTemplateImpact:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Natural

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The actions that this response plan takes at the beginning of an
--   incident.
[$sel:actions:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe [Action]

-- | A brief summary of the incident. This typically contains what has
--   happened, what's currently happening, and next steps.
[$sel:incidentTemplateSummary:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The long format name of the response plan. Can't contain spaces.
[$sel:displayName:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an
--   incident.
--   
--   Use the empty structure to remove the chat channel from the response
--   plan.
[$sel:chatChannel:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe ChatChannel

-- | Used to create only one incident record for an incident.
[$sel:incidentTemplateDedupeString:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The short format name of the incident. Can't contain spaces.
[$sel:incidentTemplateTitle:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The contacts and escalation plans that Incident Manager engages at the
--   start of the incident.
[$sel:engagements:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
[$sel:incidentTemplateNotificationTargets:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Maybe [NotificationTargetItem]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
[$sel:arn:UpdateResponsePlan'] :: UpdateResponsePlan -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateResponsePlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplateImpact:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateImpact</a> - Defines the impact
--   to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites the impact provided
--   by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - Severe impact</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - High impact</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - Low impact</li>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - No impact</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   action is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_actions</a> - The actions that this response
--   plan takes at the beginning of an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplateSummary:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateSummary</a> - A brief summary of
--   the incident. This typically contains what has happened, what's
--   currently happening, and next steps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_displayName</a> - The long format name of the
--   response plan. Can't contain spaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chatChannel:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_chatChannel</a> - The AWS Chatbot chat channel
--   used for collaboration during an incident.
--   
--   Use the empty structure to remove the chat channel from the response
--   plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplateDedupeString:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateDedupeString</a> - Used to
--   create only one incident record for an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplateTitle:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateTitle</a> - The short format
--   name of the incident. Can't contain spaces.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagements:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_engagements</a> - The contacts and escalation
--   plans that Incident Manager engages at the start of the incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentTemplateNotificationTargets:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateNotificationTargets</a> - The
--   SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an incident.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateResponsePlan'</a>, <a>updateResponsePlan_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
newUpdateResponsePlan :: Text -> UpdateResponsePlan

-- | Defines the impact to the customers. Providing an impact overwrites
--   the impact provided by a response plan.
--   
--   <b>Possible impacts:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>5</tt> - Severe impact</li>
--   <li><tt>4</tt> - High impact</li>
--   <li><tt>3</tt> - Medium impact</li>
--   <li><tt>2</tt> - Low impact</li>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> - No impact</li>
--   </ul>
updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateImpact :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Natural)

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
updateResponsePlan_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The actions that this response plan takes at the beginning of an
--   incident.
updateResponsePlan_actions :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe [Action])

-- | A brief summary of the incident. This typically contains what has
--   happened, what's currently happening, and next steps.
updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateSummary :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The long format name of the response plan. Can't contain spaces.
updateResponsePlan_displayName :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Chatbot chat channel used for collaboration during an
--   incident.
--   
--   Use the empty structure to remove the chat channel from the response
--   plan.
updateResponsePlan_chatChannel :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe ChatChannel)

-- | Used to create only one incident record for an incident.
updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateDedupeString :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The short format name of the incident. Can't contain spaces.
updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateTitle :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The contacts and escalation plans that Incident Manager engages at the
--   start of the incident.
updateResponsePlan_engagements :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe [Text])

-- | The SNS targets that are notified when updates are made to an
--   incident.
updateResponsePlan_incidentTemplateNotificationTargets :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan (Maybe [NotificationTargetItem])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the response plan.
updateResponsePlan_arn :: Lens' UpdateResponsePlan Text

-- | Updates a timeline event. You can update events of type <tt>Custom
--   Event</tt>.
module Network.AWS.SSMIncidents.UpdateTimelineEvent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateTimelineEvent</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateTimelineEvent
UpdateTimelineEvent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateTimelineEvent

-- | A short description of the event.
[$sel:eventData:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the event occurred.
[$sel:eventTime:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The type of the event. You can update events of type <tt>Custom
--   Event</tt>.
[$sel:eventType:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the event you are updating. You can find this by using
--   <tt>ListTimelineEvents</tt>.
[$sel:eventId:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident that the timeline event
--   is part of.
[$sel:incidentRecordArn:UpdateTimelineEvent'] :: UpdateTimelineEvent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTimelineEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventData:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_eventData</a> - A short description of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_clientToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   action is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTime:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_eventTime</a> - The time that the event
--   occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventType:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_eventType</a> - The type of the event. You can
--   update events of type <tt>Custom Event</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_eventId</a> - The ID of the event you are
--   updating. You can find this by using <tt>ListTimelineEvents</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentRecordArn:UpdateTimelineEvent'</a>,
--   <a>updateTimelineEvent_incidentRecordArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the incident that the timeline event is part of.
newUpdateTimelineEvent :: Text -> Text -> UpdateTimelineEvent

-- | A short description of the event.
updateTimelineEvent_eventData :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the
--   specified details.
updateTimelineEvent_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the event occurred.
updateTimelineEvent_eventTime :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of the event. You can update events of type <tt>Custom
--   Event</tt>.
updateTimelineEvent_eventType :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the event you are updating. You can find this by using
--   <tt>ListTimelineEvents</tt>.
updateTimelineEvent_eventId :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent Text

--   is part of.
updateTimelineEvent_incidentRecordArn :: Lens' UpdateTimelineEvent Text
